Problem:
Consider a function \\( z = u(x) + iv(y) \\) representing a complex function where \\( u(x) \\) and \\( v(y) \\) are real functions defined in terms of x and y, respectively. Examine the influence of the linear transformation \\( L(z) = Az + B \\) where A and B are complex constants on the evolution of the function over the complex domain.

Can we deduce the original complex number \\( z_0 \\) after observing \\( z(t) \\) at t = T without knowing whether \\( L(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without information about the application of \\( L(z) \\), we cannot distinguish whether the observed transformations in \\( z(t) \\) occurred purely due to the function \\( z = u(x) + iv(y) \\) or were influenced by the initial application of \\( L(z) \\). The modification introduced by A and B complicates tracing back to \\( z_0 \\) uniquely.
